headline: AMD On Device AI Push And New Board Member Attract Investor Interest
summary: AMD (NasdaqGS:AMD) is expanding its work with GIGABYTE to advance on-device AI across gaming laptops, motherboards, and monitors. The company is also adding former Accenture CFO KC McClure to its Board of Directors, bringing additional finance and governance experience. For investors, this development connects to an area where significant PC and AI spending is moving: AI functions running locally on devices instead of purely in the cloud. AMD’s roles in CPUs and GPUs give it exposure to...

headline: Oracle announces Equity and Debt Financing Plan for Calendar Year 2026
summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE: ORCL) today announced its full calendar year 2026 plan to fund the expansion of its rapidly growing Oracle Cloud Infrastructure business. Oracle is raising money in order to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from our largest Oracle Cloud Infrastructure customers, including AMD, Meta, NVIDIA, OpenAI, TikTok, xAI and others.

content.title: Oracle announces Equity and Debt Financing Plan for Calendar Year 2026

headline: Oracle says it plans to raise up to $50 billion in debt and equity this year
summary: Oracle expects to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026 to build additional capacity for ​its cloud infrastructure, the software company said on Sunday.  The ‌company, chaired by billionaire Larry Ellison, said it plans to achieve its funding ‌objectives using a combination of debt and equity financing.  "Oracle is raising money in order to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from our largest Oracle Cloud Infrastructure customers, ⁠including AMD, Meta, NVIDIA, ‌OpenAI, TikTok, xAI and others", the company said in a statement.

content.title: Oracle says it plans to raise up to $50 billion in debt and equity this year

The ‌company, chaired by billionaire Larry Ellison, said it plans to achieve its funding ‌objectives using a combination of debt and equity financing.  "Oracle is raising money in order to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from our largest Oracle Cloud Infrastructure customers, ⁠including AMD, Meta, NVIDIA, ‌OpenAI, TikTok, xAI and others", the company said in a statement.
